Package src

Class Player

java.lang.Object
src.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class Player extends Object implements Runnable
Represents a player in the game.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Player(int playerNumber, CardDeck deckDrawnFrom, CardDeck deckInsertedTo)
    Constructor for the Player class.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    appendToFile(String output)
    Appends the given string to the player's output file.
    Card
    drawCard()
    Draws the card at the top of the previous deck and appends to the player's output file the card they drew and from which deck.
    void
    findDiscardables()
    Checks each card in the hand and if the denomination is not equal to the player's number the card is added to the queue of discardables which contains all cards in the hand that can be discarded in future turns.

    Getter for the name of the player.

    Loops through the player's hand and inserts the card drawn into the first empty slot.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(int playerNumber, CardDeck deckDrawnFrom, CardDeck deckInsertedTo) throws FileNotFoundException
      Constructor for the Player class.
      Parameters:
      playerNumber - the number of the player
      deckDrawnFrom - the deck the player draws from
      deckInsertedTo - the deck the player inserts into
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - if the game output folder does not exist

  • Method Details

    • initialHand

      public void initialHand(Card card, int handPosition)
      Inserts the starting cards into the player's hand.
      Parameters:
      card - the card to add to the player's hand
      handPosition - the position in the hand to add the card

    • findDiscardables

      public void findDiscardables()
      Checks each card in the hand and if the denomination is not equal to the player's number the card is added to the queue of discardables which contains all cards in the hand that can be discarded in future turns.

    • appendToFile

      public void appendToFile(String output)
      Appends the given string to the player's output file.
      Parameters:
      output - string to append

    • handToString

      public String handToString()
      Returns the player's hand as a string of card values.
      Returns:
      string of card values

    • drawCard

      public Card drawCard()
      Draws the card at the top of the previous deck and appends to the player's output file the card they drew and from which deck.
      Returns:
      the card that was drawn

    • removeMostDiscardable

      public void removeMostDiscardable()
      Gets the next card to discard from the queue of discardables and removes that card from the player's hand. Then inserts the removed card into the next deck and appends to the player's output file the card they discarded and into which deck.

    • updateHand

      public void updateHand(Card drawnCard)
      Loops through the player's hand and inserts the card drawn into the first empty slot. Then checks if the card can be discarded or not in future turns. And finally appends the player's current hand to their output file.
      Parameters:
      drawnCard - the drawn card to be inserted into the hand

    • getPlayerName

      public String getPlayerName()
      Getter for the name of the player.
      Returns:
      the name of the player

    • run

      public void run()
      When they win the game, sets the atomic variable winning player to winning player's number. Then wakes up all threads as the game is now over and prints to console which player won.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
